website_summaries.verdict: The combination of an improved design and better performance makes the Marshall Major II a strong on-ear contender for around $100 USD.
pros: The affordable, comfortable Marshall Major II on-ear headphones offer improved bass performance and better clarity than the original Major model
The headphones fold inward and have a detachable cable with a one-button inline remote and microphone

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Terrible feed back, even bought a second pair directly from marshall thinking the first pair was just a manufacturing defect. No luck. Awful sound quality. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: bekahdora

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good headphones. Sound quality is good for what you ...
customer_reviews.text: Fairly good headphones. Sound quality is good for what you get for the price. The fit is a bit tight. I've been using these for a couple months on and off, and the headphones put a lot of pressure in between the ears, hence why I use them on and off. Overall, good product.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: ... these headphones for 2 months and they have been great. I'm sure you could get better sound quality ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for 2 months and they have been great. I'm sure you could get better sound quality for something more expensive, but the quality is quite good especially considering the price. I also haven't had any issues with what people have described as poor design/hardware, but I'm also fairly careful with them (although it would be great if they included a case for them, don't stuff them into a carry-on or a backpack or anything like that). Overall, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris DiGiacomo

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but hurts my ears after only 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Good sound but hurts my ears after only 15 minutes. Just too tight. Hopefully it will loosen up over time. If your head is bigger than average, avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Matthews

customer_reviews.title: MM II's Are The Truth!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am very happy with these! I listen to & work on music through monitors so "cans" never get me too excited, however, these baby's here impressed even me. For the price, you cannot go wrong (thank you to the seller, as I bought them used & got them for a steal!), they play wonderfully & faithfully reproduce mids & highs that are balance with good punch on the bottom end. They are well made & tell the truth even for this price range, recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. Great sound. I use them to play along with my set list. Plugged into my Marshall head and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Marshall who? send to the brig
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed. When I connected to my Ipad I heard nothing. Connected to walkman, I head nothing. Connected to PC, I head nothing. I took the cord and connected it to my broken headphones and that worked. So I paid over $50 for a new cord for my old headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: These are great headphones. I love the look and the sound ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones. I love the look and the sound and the cushioning, but they were just way too tight on my head. I have an average sized head, I think, and I just couldn't wear these for more than an hour (at most) at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Marshall Major II headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Much nice than the Marshall Major I. They may seem a bit tight to some people and I've heard that complaint about the Marshall Major I. I had the same experience myself, but the MM II don't seem to be as snug fitting as my pair of MM I headphones were.
customer_reviews.author: William Sapp

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, I researched several before buying these
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, I researched several before buying these. Nice on ear headphone. Great sound, good balance of size and sound quality. Coiled chord is really a great feature
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Green

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The durability and sound quality of these headphones is sexond to none.
customer_reviews.author: Viking52889

customer_reviews.title: Tight on ear
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones look good. They still hurt your ears after a while. I've been trying to stretch them out. It works somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great, you get the perfect sound and it definitely blocks outside noise. The only issue is on hot days when they can bother a bit, but other than the quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great physical and working condition
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived exactly as expected, great physical and working condition. Recommend this Seller to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth N Rodulfo

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality excellent. Able to listen to music and webinars at ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality excellent. Able to listen to music and webinars at a lower volume level. Comfortable for an hour. Then you need to take a break.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H Draper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves the headphones. Edit: After having the headphones for a year and a half they have broken. There is a plastic piece where they adjust that broke off. Hubby takes very good care of his things so this is not because of mishandling. Guess we will be looking at a different brand for replacement. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsygirl

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and cool look until they break
customer_reviews.text: These headphone broke after just a week of use. There is a design defect that is well described elsewhere on amazon and the web where the plastic hinge on the earpiece breaks away from the headband. It's really too bad because this is not what you would expect from a company like Marshall. Trying to get a refund but really, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LetsTravel

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Love how I can use either the left or right side for input and the other side can be used as an output at the same time. This is great if you wish to share what you are listening to with someone sitting next to you. The earpieces deliver decent quality output on bass and treble and the headphones fit well and are snug. Being able to fold them helps with storage and transportation. I wish Marshall would include a hard case to protest these headphones and would make it easier to purchase extra connecting cords.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Defective on arrival
customer_reviews.text: the earpieces are much smaller than they look. These are not over-ear headphones unless you are a very small person. Came brand new in box, but the cable already had a poor connection (you know, when you have to twist or press on the plug to get the sound to work in both ears). I'm disappointed because I'd read good reviews...
customer_reviews.author: A Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Is not working one side. What I have to do?
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: The headphones are damn good, the quality of sound is great
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are damn good, the quality of sound is great. Only the adapter 3,5 / 6,3MM where not included.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo López

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw
customer_reviews.text: After 1.5 years of light use as these are my office set I noticed the plastic hinge broke. As others have written this is a major design flaw rendering the set useless. Better get the Monitor with metal hinges than these.
customer_reviews.author: coconatz

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what you spect from Marshall, simply amazona.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and really nice being able to swap the ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves these. Great sound and really nice being able to swap the cord from one ear to the other.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: They did return me my money but I was disappointed in build quality
customer_reviews.text: The plastic holding the earbud snapped after two weeks of use. They did return me my money but I was disappointed in build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Cortes

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It dosnt even deserve one star. The item was damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Iftay

customer_reviews.title: very disappointing and a waste of my time
customer_reviews.text: They were not the product advertised so i had to return them. very disappointing and a waste of my time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but not comfortable at all
customer_reviews.text: Sound form these are awesome, and what I'd expect from Marshall. Problem is they are not comfortable, even after trying to break them in a few months. They sit on-ear and are very tight. Adjusting the headband or trying to flex them to loosen a bit didn'y work. Recommend their over-the-ear headphones instead.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Plastic (right above the earpieces) breaks very quickly. Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: The parts of these headphones that are made out of plastic will easily break. My girlfriend and I bought each their own pair of these and they both broke, always in the same spot (right above the earpieces), 1 WEEK after I bought mine and 3 months after she bought hers. After that happened, we were told by the store that sold them to us (Clas Olsson in Sweden) that Marshall doesn't replace headphones with physical damage, despite the fact that I presented the receipt which showed that I had bought it only a week earlier. I REALLY don't advise you waste your money on this piece of s*** product.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: They will break after a short time.
customer_reviews.text: The sound, comfort and look are great. But think twice before buying them, because the plastic brackets are very weak. They will break eventually. I had two pairs that were replaced by Marshall so far. I use them in a very safe environment: at work in a very boring office where I sit behind a desk! So I you want something that will last over the year, definitely not the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doubt
customer_reviews.text: “Hi, I bought you recently the headphones but I can only heard the music from the side that I put the cable. Can you explaned me how to fix this? or is it a failure? Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Forget Beats Audio!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome lightweight, comfortable and sound fantastic. Also love the coil cord flexibility!
customer_reviews.author: JonB

customer_reviews.title: Music for my ears and for my wallet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, easy to carry around, and with good sound quality. Oh, and one more thing, it only costed $89! It's a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Betancourt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome until... It brokes easily.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, awesome design, poor construction, the little base broke after 2 weeks of simple use.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Tosca

customer_reviews.title: Bad plastic quality
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it !!!! Bad plastic quality : it broke after a fews weeks, exactly as a lot of reviews described it Now I realize there are tons of same complains on the web about this defect.
customer_reviews.author: Laz

product_meta.title: Marshall Major II Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe wrinkled headband and contrast detailing on the Marshall Major II headphones create a true rock-and-roll vibe. Soft, on-the-ear cushions keep them comfortable, while the collapsible construction adds convenience. Remote and microphone compatible with most smartphones. Neutral stereo plug and 6.3mm adapters included.
feature_bullets: Type Ear coupling: On-ear Primary application: General listening Secondary application: Mobile Operating principle: Closed Audio Frequency response (TX): 10Hz - 20kHz SPL: 99 dB Driver size: 40mm THD: Info not available Noise cancelling: No Other Weight: Info not available Cable type: Coiled Cable Length: Info not available Connector: 3.5mm Built-in mic: Yes Bluetooth connectivity: No
With updated sound, looks and durability, as well as improved ergonomics, the Major II headphones give way to a whole new level of listening
Building upon the success of its predecessor, this set of headphones is built to last, and rocks a style that makes its presence known
Its advanced sound features include customized drivers for deeper bass, more detailed highs, and a refined mid-range-while delivering lower distortion overall
The detachable double-ended coil cord with mic and remote is equipped with an L-plug end, providing improved durability and carrying ease

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars273 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: 1 x Major II Headphones; 1 x Coil Cord
